basic_info.name: [Your Friend's Name]
learning_goals: Build a structured knowledge base that connects concepts across domains
Improve retention and recall of learned material
Apply knowledge practically to solve real-world problems
learning_style_preferences: Visual learning through diagrams and charts

active_recall.description: Testing yourself on material to strengthen neural connections
implementation: Create question sets for each learning session
Use spaced repetition scheduling for review sessions
Test knowledge application through problem-solving
Explain concepts in your own words (Feynman Technique)

spaced_repetition.description: Reviewing information at increasing intervals to optimize retention
implementation: Review new information within 24 hours of first exposure
Schedule follow-up reviews at 3 days, 1 week, 2 weeks, 1 month
Increase intervals for well-remembered information
Decrease intervals for challenging material
tools: Learning journal to track review cycles

elaborative_encoding.description: Connecting new information to existing knowledge
implementation: Create concept maps linking ideas together
Find real-world applications for theoretical concepts
Relate new learning to personal experiences
Identify similarities and differences with known concepts

cognitive_load_management.description: Optimizing mental effort to facilitate learning
implementation: Break complex topics into manageable chunks
Focus on understanding fundamentals before details
Alternate between different types of learning activities
Scaffold learning with structured frameworks

sleep_and_memory.description: Optimizing sleep patterns to enhance memory consolidation
implementation: Review important material shortly before sleep
Maintain consistent sleep schedule
Prioritize quality sleep (7-9 hours) for memory consolidation
Schedule challenging learning in the morning
tools: Morning review of previous day's learning

ai_strengths_for_learning: Providing diverse explanations of difficult concepts
Offering structured frameworks for complex topics
Assisting with knowledge synthesis and connections

context_limitations.description: LLMs have a limited context window (working memory)
implications: Cannot maintain awareness of entire learning history
May miss connections across separate conversations
Needs frequent reminders of learning context
mitigation: Regularly update this context file with new learning
Chunk learning topics for focused AI interactions

hallucinations.description: LLMs can generate plausible but incorrect information
implications: Cannot be solely relied upon for factual accuracy
May introduce misconceptions if not verified
Confidence in response is not correlated with accuracy
mitigation: Verify important facts from authoritative sources
Ask AI to provide reasoning and evidence
Use AI primarily for learning methods rather than as the sole source of facts
Request citations when asking for factual information

knowledge_cutoff.description: LLMs have a training cutoff date with no newer information
implications: May lack awareness of recent developments
Cannot provide up-to-date research or findings
mitigation: Supplement AI guidance with recent literature
Use web search when discussing evolving topics
Update context file with recent findings

learning_prompts: Explain [concept] using multiple analogies from different domains
Generate a set of practice questions that test application of [concept]
Create a framework for understanding the relationship between [concept A] and [concept B]
What are common misconceptions about [topic] and how can I avoid them?
How would you structure a learning plan for mastering [topic] in [timeframe]?
metacognitive_prompts: What questions should I be asking myself to deepen my understanding of [topic]?
What mental models would be most useful for thinking about [domain]?
How can I test whether I truly understand [concept] versus just recognizing it?
What would be effective ways to connect [new concept] to [existing knowledge]?
retrieval_practice_prompts: Based on our previous discussions about [topic], what concepts do you think I should review?
Can you generate a mini-quiz about [topic] we discussed [timeframe] ago?
What connections exist between [previous topic] and [current topic]?

instruction.primary: Use this context to provide personalized learning guidance that accounts for my cognitive profile, preferred learning strategies, and current knowledge level. Help me implement evidence-based learning techniques with a focus on long-term retention and practical application.

learning_support.explanations: Provide explanations that connect to my existing knowledge and learning style preferences
learning_support.practice: Generate questions and scenarios that employ active recall and application of concepts
learning_support.metacognition: Help me reflect on my learning process and identify strategies for improvement
learning_support.connections: Identify relationships between new concepts and previously learned material

instruction.context_update: When I share new learning progress or insights, suggest specific updates to this context file to maintain its relevance. Ask questions to clarify my learning experiences when needed.
instruction.verification_protocol: For factual information, provide reasoning and evidence for your responses. Clearly indicate when information might be uncertain or when verification from other sources would be beneficial.
instruction.adaptive_approach: Adjust your support based on my reported progress and challenges. If I'm struggling with a concept, offer alternative explanations or approaches tailored to my cognitive profile.
